pullRequest.body:
Convergence of a sequence in nonarchimedean spaces only requires differences to go to zero


---

- ...

### PR summary [7564d38bee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21153/commits/7564d38beead125d6cabb0be2da8c1ecadf6de43)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ cauchySeq_of_tendsto_div_nhds_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks! What do you think about an `iff` direction? Also, I couldn't find a better file to place these. Do you have an idea?

Looks good now, modulo a minor typo (see suggestion). I think the file you put it in makes sense. An `iff` direction might be useful, but¬†I don't think you can take the proof here and make it reversible; the converse would need a separate proof of its own proved separately. So I suggest saving it for another PR.

maintainer delegate
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
I'm able to do the reverse direction in a metric space, but in the generality of this `NonarchimedeanGroup`, I haven't yet found a way. So I'm fine with leaving it.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13025316133/job/36333282169)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13025316133/job/36333282314)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Looks nice! I suggested some golfs.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

How about
```suggestion
  suffices Tendsto (fun p : ‚Ñï √ó ‚Ñï ‚Ü¶ f p.2 / f p.1) atTop (ùìù 1) by simpa [CauchySeq, 
    cauchy_map_iff, prod_atTop_atTop_eq, uniformity_eq_comap_nhds_one G, atTop_neBot]
```
This is easier to read (you don't need to rely on the infoview to know what the goal is for the rest of the proof) and it's also more robust since the simp is terminal and hence can be left un-squeezed, so it won't break if the simp lemmas get renamed.

slightly slicker
```suggestion
  obtain ‚ü®N, hN‚ü© : ‚àÉ N : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ b, N ‚â§ b ‚Üí f (b + 1) / f b ‚àà t := by
    simpa using tendsto_def.mp hf t t.mem_nhds_one
```

```suggestion
  rintro ‚ü®M, M'‚ü© ‚ü®(hMN : N ‚â§ M), (hMN' : N ‚â§ M')‚ü©
```
`apply ht` works I think

```suggestion
  ¬∑ simpa [inv_div] using t.inv_mem <| this _ _ hMN' hMN (le_of_not_ge h)
```

```suggestion
  | succ k ih => simpa using t.mul_mem (hN _ (by omega : N ‚â§ M + k)) ih
```

Please spell out "quotients `f (n + 1) / f n`", otherwise it's not very clear (& likewise for the additive docstring). Also I think "multiplicative" is redundant, groups in Mathlib are multiplicative unless stated otherwise.

```suggestion
such that the quotients `f (n + 1) / f n` tend to one. Then the function is a Cauchy sequence. -/
@[to_additive "Let `G` be a nonarchimedean additive abelian group, and let `f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí G` be a
function such that the differences `f (n + 1) - f n` tend to zero.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Nonarchimedean): cauchySeq_of_tendsto_div_nhds_one
